etymology.description: semantic: 气(氣) (qì, "air") + phonetic: 其(其) (qí, "his") = giving false atmosphere -> deceive
etymology.interpretation: 欺(欺) (qī, "deceive") combines 气(氣) (qì, "air"), suggesting something intangible, with 其(其) (qí, "his"), which provides the phonetic element. Together, these imply creating a false impression or atmosphere, aligning with the meaning of deception.

examples.chinese: 不要欺别人(不要欺別人)。
他以花言巧语欺骗了村民(他以花言巧語欺騙了村民)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐ huāyán qiǎoyǔ qī piàn le cūnmín.
examples.english: He deceived the villagers with flowery words.

examples.chinese: 商家欺骗消费者(商家欺騙消費者)，赢得了一时的利益(贏得了一時的利益)。
examples.pinyin: Shāngjiā qī piàn xiāofèi zhě, yíng dé le yìshí de lìyì.
examples.english: The merchant deceived the consumers and gained a temporary profit.
